summary.span: Converts a base data type to another base data type.

span.span: Converts a base data type to another base data type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 静态方法类主要用于在.NET Framework 中支持基本数据类型之间的转换。The static methods of the class are primarily used to support conversion to and from the base data types in the .NET Framework. 支持的基类型为， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ，，和。The supported base types are , , , , , , , , , , , , , and . 此外，类包含方法以支持其他类型的转换。In addition, the class includes methods to support other kinds of conversions. 本主题包括以下各节：This topic consists of the following sections: [基类型之间的转换](#Base) [Conversions to and from Base Types](#Base) [非十进制数字](#NonDecimal) [Non-Decimal Numbers](#NonDecimal) [从自定义对象转换为基类型](#Custom) [Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types](#Custom) [特定于区域性的格式设置信息](#Culture) [Culture-Specific Formatting Information](#Culture) [Base64 编码](#Base64) [Base64 Encoding](#Base64) [其他常见的转换Other Common Conversions](#Other) ## 基类型之间的转换Conversions to and from Base Types 转换方法的目的是将每个基类型转换为其他每个基类型。A conversion method exists to convert every base type to every other base type. 但是，对特定的转换方法的实际调用可生成五个结果，具体取决于在运行时的基类型和目标基类型的值中的一个。However, the actual call to a particular conversion method can produce one of five outcomes, depending on the value of the base type at run time and the target base type. 这五个结果如下：These five outcomes are: - 不进行转换。No conversion. 发生这种情况时尝试从一个类型转换到其自身 (例如，通过调用类型的自变量与)。This occurs when an attempt is made to convert from a type to itself (for example, by calling with an argument of type ). 在这种情况下，该方法只需返回原始类型的实例。In this case, the method simply returns an instance of the original type. - 一个 。An . 不支持特定的转换时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when a particular conversion is not supported. 引发以下转换：An is thrown for the following conversions: - 从转换到， ， ， ，或。Conversions from to , , , , or . - 从转换， ， ， ，或到。Conversions from , , , , or to . - 从转换以外的任何其他类型到。Conversions from to any other type except . - 从任何其他类型的转换除外到。Conversions from any other type, except , to . - 。A . 将字符串值转换为其他任何基类型的尝试会失败，因为字符串未采用正确格式时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when the attempt to convert a string value to any other base type fails because the string is not in the proper format. 以下转换会引发异常：The exception is thrown for the following conversions: - 一个字符串，转换到值不等于或。A string to be converted to a value does not equal or . - 一个字符串，转换到值包含的多个字符。A string to be converted to a value consists of multiple characters. - 要转换为任何数值类型的字符串未被识别为有效数字。A string to be converted to any numeric type is not recognized as a valid number. - 一个字符串，转换到未被识别为有效的日期和时间值。A string to be converted to a is not recognized as a valid date and time value. - 成功的转换。A successful conversion. 对于未在前面的结果中列出的两个不同的基类型之间转换，所有的扩大转换，以及所有不会导致数据丢失的收缩转换将成功，并且该方法将返回目标的基类型的值。For conversions between two different base types not listed in the previous outcomes, all widening conversions as well as all narrowing conversions that do not result in a loss of data will succeed and the method will return a value of the targeted base type. - 一个 。An . 在数据丢失的收缩转换结果时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when a narrowing conversion results in a loss of data. 例如，尝试将转换实例，其值是 10000 到类型，则会引发因为 10000 的范围之外数据类型。For example, trying to convert a instance whose value is 10000 to a type throws an because 10000 is outside the range of the data type. 如果数值类型的转换会导致丢失精度 （即，丢失某些最小有效位），则不会引发异常。An exception will not be thrown if the conversion of a numeric type results in a loss of precision (that is, the loss of some least significant digits). 但是，如果结果为不是特定的转换方法的返回值类型可以表示更大，则将引发异常。However, an exception will be thrown if the result is larger than can be represented by the particular conversion method's return value type. 例如，当转换为，可能发生精度损失，但不会引发异常。For example, when a is converted to a , a loss of precision might occur but no exception is thrown. 但是，如果的量太大而无法由表示，将引发溢出异常。However, if the magnitude of the is too large to be represented by a , an overflow exception is thrown. ## 非十进制数字Non-Decimal Numbers 类包含静态方法可以调用以将整数值转换为非十进制字符串表示形式，并且将转换字符串到整数值，表示非十进制数字。The class includes static methods that you can call to convert integral values to non-decimal string representations, and to convert strings that represent non-decimal numbers to integral values. 每个转换方法包含`base`允许您指定的数字系统; 二进制 (基数为 2)、 八进制 (基数为 8) 和十六进制 (基数为 16)，以及十进制 (基数为 10) 的参数。Each of these conversion methods includes a `base` argument that lets you specify the number system; binary (base 2), octal (base 8), and hexadecimal (base 16), as well as decimal (base 10). 还有一组方法来将每个符合 CLS 規格基元整型类型转换为一个字符串，另一个用于将字符串转换为每个基元整型类型：There is a set of methods to convert each of the CLS-compliant primitive integral types to a string, and one to convert a string to each of the primitive integral types: - 和、 和中将指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的字节值。 and , to convert a byte value to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中将指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的 16 位有符号的整数。 and , to convert a 16-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中将指定基数的字符串之间相互转换 32 位有符号的整数。 and , to convert a 32-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中将指定基数的字符串之间相互转换 64 位有符号的整数。 and , to convert a 64-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 若要将指定格式的字节值的字符串表示形式转换为有符号字节。, to convert the string representation of a byte value in a specified format to a signed byte. - 若要将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为 16 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 16-bit integer. - 若要将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为 32 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 32-bit integer. - 若要将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为 64 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 64-bit integer. 下面的示例将的值转换到字符串中所有受支持的数字格式。The following example converts the value of to a string in all supported numeric formats. 然后，它将转换的字符串值返回到值。It then converts the string value back to a value. [!code-cpp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/NonDecimal1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/NonDecimal1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/NonDecimal1.vb#2)] ## 从自定义对象转换为基类型Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types 除了支持中基类型之间的转换方法支持的任何自定义类型转换为任何基类型。In addition to supporting conversions between the base types, the method supports conversion of any custom type to any base type. 若要执行此操作，自定义的类型必须实现接口，定义用于将实现类型转换为每个基类型的方法。To do this, the custom type must implement the interface, which defines methods for converting the implementing type to each of the base types. 不支持特定类型的转换应引发。Conversions that are not supported by a particular type should throw an . 当方法作为其第一个参数传递的自定义类型时，或者当`Convert.To`*类型*方法 (如或调用和作为其第一个传递自定义类型的实例参数，方法中，依次调用自定义类型实现来执行此转换。When the method is passed a custom type as its first parameter, or when the `Convert.To`*Type* method (such as or is called and passed an instance of a custom type as its first parameter, the method, in turn, calls the custom type's implementation to perform the conversion. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的类型转换](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md)。For more information, see [Type Conversion in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md). ## 特定于区域性的格式设置信息Culture-Specific Formatting Information 所有基类型转换方法和方法包含具有类型的参数的重载。All the base type conversion methods and the method include overloads that have a parameter of type . 例如，方法有以下两个重载：For example, the method has the following two overloads: - - 参数可以提供特定于区域性的格式设置信息以帮助转换过程。The parameter can supply culture-specific formatting information to assist the conversion process. 但是，它会忽略大多数的基类型转换方法。However, it is ignored by most of the base type conversion methods. 它仅供以下基类型转换方法。如果`null`自变量传递给这些方法，使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。It is used only by the following base type conversion methods.If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 通过将值转换为数值类型的方法。By methods that convert a value to a numeric type. 参数将使用具有类型参数的重载和。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 它还由具有类型参数的重载并对象的运行时类型是否为。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过将值转换为日期和时间的方法。By methods that convert a value to a date and time. 参数将使用具有类型参数的重载和。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 它还由具有类型参数的重载并对象的运行时类型是否为。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过包括的重载参数和的数字值转换为字符串或为字符串值。By the overloads that include an parameter and that convert either a numeric value to a string or a value to a string. 但是，任何用户定义类型的实现可以进行利用参数。However, any user-defined type that implements can make use of the parameter. ## Base64 编码Base64 Encoding Base64 编码转换为字符串的二进制数据。Base64 encoding converts binary data to a string. 以 base-64 位数字表示的数据可以很容易地通过仅可以传输 7 位字符的数据通道。Data expressed as base-64 digits can be easily conveyed over data channels that can only transmit 7-bit characters. 类包括以下方法来支持 base64 编码： 来回转换的字节数组的方法支持一组或者向 / 从 base 64 数字字符组成的 Unicode 字符数组。The class includes the following methods to support base64 encoding: A set of methods support converting an array of bytes to and from a or to and from an array of Unicode characters consisting of base-64 digit characters. - 它将一个字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符串。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded string. - 它将一个字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符数组。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded character array. - 它将是 base64 编码的字符串转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded string to a byte array. - 它将 base64 编码的字符数组转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded character array to a byte array. ## 其他常见的转换Other Common Conversions 可以使用其他类在.NET Framework 中执行的静态方法不支持某些转换类。You can use other classes in the NET Framework to perform some conversions that are not supported by the static methods of the class. 这些方法包括：These include: 转换为字节数组Conversion to byte arrays 类提供了将基元数值类型转换的方法 (包括) 到字节数组，并从字节数组返回给基元数据类型。The class provides methods that convert the primitive numeric types (including ) to byte arrays and from byte arrays back to primitive data types. 字符编码和解码Character encoding and decoding 类和其派生的类 (如和) 提供多种方法来进行编码的字符数组或字符串 (即，若要将它们转换为特定编码的字节数组) 和进行解码已编码的字节 （即，数组将字节数组转换为 UTF16 编码的 Unicode 字符。The class and its derived classes (such as and ) provide methods to encode a character array or a string (that is, to convert them to a byte array in a particular encoding) and to decode an encoded byte array (that is, convert a byte array back to UTF16-encoded Unicode characters. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的字符编码](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md)For more information, see [Character Encoding in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md) ## Examples 以下示例演示了部分中的转换方法类，其中包括， ，和。The following example demonstrates some of the conversion methods in the class, including , , and . [!code-cpp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/converter.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/converter.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/converter.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法将指定的对象转换`value`到`conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象和`conversionType`也可以是表示任何基本或自定义类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到相应的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 该方法需要该转换`value`到`conversionType`支持。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. 此方法转换为使用当前线程的区域性。This method uses the current thread's culture for the conversion. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法的用法。The following example illustrates the use of the method. [!code-cpp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CPP/convertchangetype.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CS/convertchangetype.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/VB/convertchangetype.vb#1)]

span.para: 方法可以将一个枚举值转换为另一种类型。但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为枚举值，即使源类型是枚举的基础类型。若要将一个类型转换为枚举值，使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。下面的示例演示转换来回洲枚举值。 [！ code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)][！ code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)] 方法可以将为 null 的类型转换为另一种类型。但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为值为 null 的类型，即使是的基础类型。若要执行转换，可以使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。下面的示例演示转换与 null 的类型。 [！ code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable.cs#7)][！ code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable.vb#7)]

The method can convert an enumeration value to another type. However, it cannot convert another type to an enumeration value, even if the source type is the underlying type of the enumeration. To convert a type to an enumeration value, use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a Continent enumeration value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)] The method can convert a nullable type to another type. However, it cannot convert another type to a value of a nullable type, even if is the underlying type of the .To perform the conversion, you can use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a nullable type. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法将指定的对象转换`value`到指定的预定义类型`typeCode`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到相应的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 此方法还要求该转换`value`到`typeCode`支持。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持的转换`value`到自定义类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，调用方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法，以更改指定的类型为参数，如有可能。The following example illustrates how to use the method to change an to the type specified by the parameter, if possible. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype_01.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype01.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype01.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法将指定的对象转换`value`到`conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象和`conversionType`也可以是表示任何基本或自定义类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到相应的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 该方法需要该转换`value`到`conversionType`支持。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. `provider`参数是实现，提供用于转换的格式设置信息。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果`value`是基本数据类型，`provider`仅用于以下转换：If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions: - 从数字转换为字符串，或为数字的字符串的转换。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是对象，对象或自定义返回的实现对象。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，由于方法执行使用默认"G"格式说明符，则转换`provider`参数无任何效果，如果`value`或目标类型是一个无符号的整数。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 从转换值为一个字符串，或从字符串到值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是或对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. 如果`value`是应用程序定义的类型，其实现可能使用`provider`参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype03.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype03.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype03.vb#3)] 下面的示例创建的实例`Temperature`类并调用方法以将其转换为受支持的.NET framework 和个基本数字类型。The following example creates an instance of the `Temperature` class and calls the method to convert it to the basic numeric types supported by the .NET Framework and to a . 它演示了方法包装对源类型的调用实现。It illustrates that the method wraps a call to the source type's implementation. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype03.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype03.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype03.vb#4)]

span.para: 方法可以将一个枚举值转换为另一种类型。但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为枚举值，即使源类型是枚举的基础类型。若要将一个类型转换为枚举值，使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。下面的示例演示转换来回洲枚举值。 [！ code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)][！ code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)] 方法可以将为 null 的类型转换为另一种类型。但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为值为 null 的类型，即使是的基础类型。若要执行转换，可以使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。下面的示例演示转换与 null 的类型。 [！ code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable_1.cs#8)][！ code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable_1.vb#8)]

The method can convert an enumeration value to another type. However, it cannot convert another type to an enumeration value, even if the source type is the underlying type of the enumeration. To convert a type to an enumeration value, use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a Continent enumeration value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)] The method can convert a nullable type to another type. However, it cannot convert another type to a value of a nullable type, even if is the underlying type of the . To perform the conversion, you can use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a nullable type. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable_1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable_1.vb#8)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法将指定的对象转换`value`到指定的预定义类型`typeCode`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到相应的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 此方法还要求该转换`value`到`typeCode`支持。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持的转换`value`到自定义类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，调用方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. `provider`参数是实现，提供用于转换的格式设置信息。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果`value`是基本数据类型，`provider`仅用于下列转换。If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions. 如果`null`自变量传递给这些方法，使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 从数字转换为字符串，或为数字的字符串的转换。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是对象，对象或自定义返回的实现对象。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，由于方法执行使用默认"G"格式说明符，则转换`provider`参数无任何效果，如果`value`或目标类型是一个无符号的整数。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. - 从转换值为一个字符串，或从字符串到值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是或对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果`value`是应用程序定义的类型，其实现可能使用`provider`参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义名为的自定义格式提供程序`InterceptProvider`，该值指示当其方法调用，并返回为 FR-FR 区域性和EN-US 区域性的对象。The following example defines a custom format provider named `InterceptProvider` that indicates when its method is called and returns a for the fr-FR culture and a object for the en-US culture. 此格式提供程序用于所有调用方法。This format provider is used in all calls to the method. 然后，该示例创建一个包含的数组和一个值，并可重复的调用与每个值的每个成员枚举。The example then creates an array with a and a value and makes repeated calls to with each value and each member of the enumeration. 该示例阐释了当该方法使用参数，还演示如何使用`provider`参数，以执行区分区域性的格式。The example illustrates when the method uses the parameter and also illustrates the use of the `provider` parameter to perform culture-sensitive formatting. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype00.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype00.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype00.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 是 base 64 数字、 空格字符和尾随填充字符组成。`inArray` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符，其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位，将选项卡 （字符表，U + 0009）、 换行符 （换行，U + 000A） 回车 （回车符，U+000D） 和空白 （空格，U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). 任意数目的空白字符可以出现在`inArray`因为所有空白字符将被都忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `inArray` because all white-space characters are ignored. 无值的字符、"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. 结束`inArray`可以包含零个、 一个，或两个填充字符。The end of `inArray` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字符数组，其中包含要解码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single character array that contains all the data to be decoded. 若要解码的流的 base-64 字符数据，请使用类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何将方法进行解码的数据进行 Uuencode (base-64)，并将其保存为二进制输出。The following example demonstrates the use of the method to decode UUencoded (base-64) data and save it as binary output. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#3)] 下面的示例演示和方法。The following example demonstrates the and methods. 输入分为三个字节数 (24 bits) 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组包含四个 6 位数字，其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 个。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有一个字节显示剩余的 85 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字、"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits, "A", "A", "E", and "C", at the beginning of the output. 如果整 3 字节组数不存在，实际上会用零以形成一个完整的组填充剩余的字节数。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值为十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位均为十进制的 63，对应的输出的末尾处为 base-64 位"/"，并下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成对应于"w"base-64 位的十进制 48。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s` 是 base 64 数字、 空格字符和尾随填充字符组成。`s` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符，其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位，将选项卡 （字符表，U + 0009）、 换行符 （换行，U + 000A） 回车 （回车符，U+000D） 和空白 （空格，U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). 任意数目的空白字符可以出现在`s`因为所有空白字符将被都忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `s` because all white-space characters are ignored. 无值的字符、"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. 结束`s`可以包含零个、 一个，或两个填充字符。The end of `s` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法，可以处理包含要解码的所有数据的单个字符串。The method is designed to process a single string that contains all the data to be decoded. 若要解码的流的 base-64 字符数据，请使用类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将字节数组转换为 string 进行 Uuencode (base-64)，然后调用方法还原原始字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是更复杂的示例创建一个 32 位整数的 20 元素数组。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用方法，将每个元素转换为字节数组，它将存储在缓冲区中的相应位置通过调用方法。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 然后，此缓冲区传递到方法创建进行 Uuencode (base-64) 字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用方法进行解码容易被解码的字符串，并调用方法，将四个字节 （32 位整数的大小） 的每个集转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 示例输出显示已成功还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法测试是否`value`参数等于。The method tests whether the `value` parameter is equal to . 它等效于以下代码：It is equivalent to the following code: [!code-csharp[System.Convert.IsDBNull#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.IsDBNull/cs/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.IsDBNull#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.IsDBNull/vb/Form1.vb#1)] > [!NOTE] > 用于指示缺少的值。 is used to indicate a value that is missing. 并不等同于`null`或。It is not equivalent to `null` or to . 因此，这段代码`Convert.IsDBNull(null)`C# 中或`Convert.IsDBNull(Nothing)`在 Visual Basic 返回`false`。Therefore, code such as `Convert.IsDBNull(null)` in C# or `Convert.IsDBNull(Nothing)` in Visual Basic returns`false`. ## Examples 下面的示例使用对象以从数据库中检索调查数据。The following example uses a object to retrieve survey data from a database. 它分配到一个数组中的每个行的字段值，然后将每个数组元素方法。It assigns each row's field values to an array, and then passes each array element to the method. 如果该方法返回`true`，该示例将字符串"NA"分配到的数组元素。If the method returns `true`, the example assigns the string "NA" to the array element. 该数组然后添加至的集合控件。The array is then added to the collection of a control. remarks.format: ## Remarks 子集`length`的元素`inArray`位置开始`offsetIn`，为数字值，并且转换中的元素子集`outArray`位置开始`offsetOut`。The subset of `length` elements of `inArray` starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in `outArray` starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示在转换后的元素数`outArray`。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. 子集`outArray`base-64 位数字组成。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符、"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数都是 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn`和`offsetOut`参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要创建一个 base-64 字符数组，从字节流，请使用类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了如何使用UUencode 方法 （以 base 64 编码的） 二进制流，然后保存到文件的编码。The following example demonstrates using the method to UUencode (encode in base 64) a binary stream, then save the encoding to a file. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 子集`length`的元素`inArray`起始位置的参数`offsetIn`，为数字值，并且转换中的元素子集`outArray`起始位置参数`offsetOut`。The subset of `length` elements of the `inArray` parameter starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in the `outArray` parameter starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示在转换后的元素数`outArray`。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. 子集`outArray`base-64 位数字组成。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数都是 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn`和`offsetOut`参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要创建一个 base-64 字符数组，从字节流，请使用类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每隔 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U+000D) 在行后跟源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"，网址[ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入分为三个字节数 (24 bits) 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组包含四个 6 位数字，其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 个。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有一个字节显示剩余的 85 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果整 3 字节组数不存在，实际上会用零以形成一个完整的组填充剩余的字节数。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值为十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位均为十进制的 63，对应的输出的末尾处为 base-64 位"/"，并下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成对应于"w"base-64 位的十进制 48。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

returns.span: The string representation, in base 64, of the contents of .

span.span: The string representation, in base 64, of the contents of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`为数字值，并且转换为用 base64 数字编码的字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符、"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要编码流中的数据，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 通常，方法不是使用保存/还原进行 Uuencode (base-64 编码) 字符串。Ordinarily, the method is not used to round-trip a UUEncoded (base-64 encoded) string. 也就是说，如果对字符串进行解码通过调用方法，然后对返回的字节数组进行编码通过调用方法，生成的字符串并不一定是相同的原始字符串。That is, if you decode a string by calling the method, then encode the returned byte array by calling the method, the resulting string will not necessarily be identical to the original string. 仅当原始字符串是有效的 base-64 编码的字符串，该字符串会往返。The string will round-trip only if the original string is a valid base-64 encoded string. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将字节数组转换为 string 进行 Uuencode (base-64)，然后调用方法还原原始字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是更复杂的示例创建一个 32 位整数的 20 元素数组。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用方法，将每个元素转换为字节数组，它将存储在缓冲区中的相应位置通过调用方法。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 然后，此缓冲区传递到方法创建进行 Uuencode (base-64) 字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用方法进行解码容易被解码的字符串，并调用方法，将四个字节 （32 位整数的大小） 的每个集转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 示例输出显示已成功还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`参数为数字值，并且转换为以 base64 字符串表示形式。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要编码流中的数据，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每隔 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U+000D) 在行后跟源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 由于换行被视为以 base-64 编码形式的空白字符，因此转换 base-64 编码的字符串返回到字节数组时，将忽略它们。Because line breaks are considered whitespace characters in a base-64 encoding, they are ignored when converting a base-64 encoded string back to a byte array. 与控件或设备如控制台窗口显示已编码的字符串时，换行符将只是非常方便。The line breaks are simply convenient when displaying the encoded string to a control or a device such as a console window. 详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"，网址[ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例调用与参数，以将行插入分页符中生成的编码 100 元素字节数组的字符串。The following example calls the with a argument to insert line breaks in the string that is produced by encoding a 100-element byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String3.vb#3)] 中的示例所示，输出的形式中还原原始的字节数组; 成功转换过程中忽略换行符。As the output from the example shows, the succeeds in restoring the original byte array; the line break characters are ignored during the conversion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`为数字值，并且转换为以 base64 字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符、"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数都是 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset`参数是从零开始。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要编码流中的数据，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`参数为数字值，并且转换为以 base64 字符串表示形式。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 按升序从零开始的 base-64 位为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 无值的字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数都是 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset`参数是从零开始。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要编码流中的数据，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每隔 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U+000D) 在行后跟源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"，网址[ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入分为三个字节数 (24 bits) 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组包含四个 6 位数字，其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 个。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有一个字节显示剩余的 85 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果整 3 字节组数不存在，实际上会用零以形成一个完整的组填充剩余的字节数。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值为十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位均为十进制的 63，对应的输出的末尾处为 base-64 位"/"，并下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成对应于"w"base-64 位的十进制 48。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64string#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64string/CPP/tb64s.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64string#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64string/CS/tb64s.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64string#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64string/VB/tb64s.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，如果可以使用参数`value`是用户定义的类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `ByteString` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `ByteString` class that implements the interface. 该类存储的登录字段，以及一个字节值的字符串表示形式，这样就能够表示这两个符号和无符号字节值。The class stores the string representation of a byte value along with a sign field, so that it is able to represent both signed and unsigned byte values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte3.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte3.vb#12)] 下面的示例实例化多个`ByteString`对象，并调用方法以将其转换为字节值。The following example instantiates several `ByteString` objects and calls the method to convert them to byte values. 它演示了方法包装对的调用对象要转换的方法。It illustrates that the method wraps a call to the method of the object to be converted. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte3.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte3.vb#13)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 是获取的实例对象。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供特定于区域性的格式信息`value`。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`，则对象使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. 如果您不想处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是否成功。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个自定义对象，它定义为"pos"和负号为"neg"，它对的调用中使用的正号方法。The following example creates a custom object that defines the positive sign as "pos" and the negative sign as "neg", which it uses in calls to the method. 然后，它调用方法重复将转换为字符串数组中的每个元素值。It then calls the method repeatedly to convert each element in a string array to a value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte4.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte4.vb#14)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅方法假设`value`使用未签名的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，全部八位用于表示的数字值和符号位不存在。In other words, all eight bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，就可以编写一个有符号的字节值的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed byte value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"to 128 0x80 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80 converts to 128." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#3)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员，验证方法或运算符在使用适当的数字表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种用于确保该方法不会不恰当地使用 unsigned 二进制表示形式，它将转换为十六进制字符串表示形式时值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use unsigned binary representation when it converts a hexadecimal string representation to a value. 该示例确定值是否表示有符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当此示例将转换值改回值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value back to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果这样，并且其高顺序位被设置 （这指示的值为负，并且它使用两个是补充而不是未签名的二进制表示形式），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the value is negative and that it uses two's complement instead of unsigned binary representation), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#4)] ## Examples 下面的示例或者尝试将一个字符串数组解释为二进制、 八进制、 十进制和十六进制值的表示形式。The following example alternately attempts to interpret an array of strings as the representation of binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte2.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte2.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`不是`null`，返回值是调用的结果方法`value`使用中的格式设置信息初始化为当前区域性的对象。If `value` is not `null`, the return value is the result of invoking the method on `value` using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current culture. `value`参数必须包含的表示形式的日期和时间格式之一中所述主题。The `value` argument must contain the representation of a date and time in one of the formats described in the topic. 如果 `value` 为 `null`，则此方法返回 。If `value` is `null`, the method returns . 此方法尝试分析`value`完全并避免引发。This method tries to parse `value` completely and avoid throwing a . 它将完成缺失的月、 日和年信息与当前日期。It completes missing month, day, and year information with the current date. 如果`value`包含仅日期而没有时间，此方法采用午夜的时间。If `value` contains only a date and no time, this method assumes a time of midnight. 任何前导、 内部或尾随空白字符在`value`将被忽略。Any leading, inner, or trailing white-space characters in `value` are ignored. 如果您不想处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是否成功。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换的日期和时间，以各种字符串表示形式值。The following example uses the method to convert various string representations of dates and times to values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是，它表示日期，`provider`可能会提供有关用于表示该日期的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a date, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that date. `provider` 是中的转换涉及`value`的运行时类型的`value`是，或者如果`value`是用户定义类型，该类型实现利用`provider`。`provider` is involved in the conversion of `value` if the runtime type of `value` is a , or if `value` is a user-defined type whose implementation makes use of `provider`. 如果运行时类型的`value`是并`provider`是`null`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If the runtime type of `value` is and `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义的自定义格式提供程序中， `CustomProvider`，其方法将消息输出到控制台，它已调用，然后返回区域性名称作为参数传递给它的类的对象构造函数。The following example defines a custom format provider, `CustomProvider`, whose method outputs a message to the console that it has been invoked, and then returns the object of the culture whose name was passed as a parameter to its class constructor. 每种`CustomProvider`对象用于将一个对象数组中的元素转换为日期和时间值。Each of these `CustomProvider` objects is used to convert the elements in an object array to date and time values. 该输出指示`CustomProvider`在转换中使用对象时，才的类型`value`参数是。The output indicates that the `CustomProvider` object is used in the conversion only when the type of the `value` parameter is a . remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数字表示形式，不受支持的负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个整数 （第 15 位） 的最高序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 15) as its sign bit. 因此，就可以编写非十进制数字的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例递增，将生成的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"-32768 到 0x8000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to -32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#5)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员若要验证的方法使用相应的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过第一个检索之前将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式的数字值的符号。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正，但转换回整数结果值为负，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示一个数字，`provider`可能会提供有关使用用于表示该数字的符号的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，如果可以使用参数`value`是用户定义的类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现，该类实现的类和。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现类的对象保存的数组值。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 每个类的对象传递给`ToInt32`方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToInt32` method. 此方法返回的数组的平均值使用实现的对象的值来确定如何计算平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method on `value`. `provider` 是获取的实例对象。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供特定于区域性的格式信息`value`。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. 如果您不想处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是否成功。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义对象，它会将字符串"pos"识别为正号和字符串"neg"为负号。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 它会尝试将数字的字符串数组的每个元素转换为整数使用这两个此提供程序和用于固定区域性的提供程序。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an integer using both this provider and the provider for the invariant culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数字表示形式，不受支持的负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个整数 （第 31 位） 的最高序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 31) as its sign bit. 因此，就可以编写非十进制数字的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例递增，将生成的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"to-2147483648 0x80000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to -2147483648." [!code-cpp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cpp/toint_str_int32.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#1)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员若要验证的方法使用相应的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过第一个检索之前将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式的数字值的符号。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正，但转换回整数结果值为负，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cpp/toint_str_int32.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数字表示形式，不受支持的负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个长整型 （第 63 位） 的最高序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of a long integer (bit 63) as its sign bit. 因此，就可以编写非十进制数字的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"为-1 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#7)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员若要验证的方法使用相应的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，可以确保正确地方法处理溢出，首先确定值是否表示一个无符号或带符号的类型时将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为无符号的类型，但转换回整数结果的符号位的值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to an integer yields a value whose sign bit is on. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数字表示形式，不受支持的负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个字节 （7 位） 的高顺序位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the high-order bit of a byte (bit 7) as its sign bit. 因此，就可以编写非十进制数字的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"-1 到 0xff 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xff converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#9)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员若要验证的方法使用相应的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，可以确保正确地方法处理溢出，首先确定值是否表示一个无符号或带符号的类型时将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为无符号的类型，而转换回有符号字节的结果的符号位的值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to a signed byte yields a value whose sign bit is on. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#10)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将元素中将字符串数组作为二进制、 八进制和十六进制表示形式的数字值解释以将其转换为无符号字节。The following example attempts to interpret the elements in a string array as the binary, octal, and hexadecimal representation of numeric values in order to convert them to unsigned bytes. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToSByte#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tosbyte/cs/tosbyte3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToSByte#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tosbyte/vb/tosbyte3.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`为正和`toBase`是 2、 8 或 16，则返回的字符串将使用符号数值表示法。If `value` is positive and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses sign-and-magnitude representation. 如果`value`为负和`toBase`是 2、 8 或 16，则返回的字符串将使用 2 的补数表示。If `value` is negative and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses two's complement representation. 这意味着高序位字节 （第 15 位） 的高顺序位被解释为符号位。This means that the high-order bit of the high-order byte (bit 15) is interpreted as the sign bit. 如果调用方法来创建更高版本将转换回数字的字符串，应调用采用类似的数字表示形式的相应方法来执行此转换。If the method is called to create a string that will later be converted back to a number, a corresponding method that assumes a similar numeric representation should be called to perform the conversion. 此类方法包括和。Such methods include and . ## Examples 下面的示例将每个元素中的 16 位有符号整数数组转换为其等效的二进制、 八进制、 十进制和十六进制字符串表示形式。The following example converts each element in an array of 16-bit signed integers to its equivalent binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal string representations. exception.span: is not 2, 8, 10, or 16.

span.span: is not 2, 8, 10, or 16.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`参数执行接口的方法调用实现`value`。If the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls the implementation of `value`. 否则为如果`value`参数执行接口的方法调用其实现。Otherwise, if the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls its implementation. 如果`value`实现两个接口方法调用`value`参数的`ToString()`方法，和`provider`参数将被忽略。If `value` implements neither interface, the method calls the `value` parameter's `ToString()` method, and the `provider` parameter is ignored. `provider`如果使用参数`value`参数实现或接口。The `provider` parameter is used if the `value` parameter implements the or interface. 最常见用法`provider`参数是指定的转换中使用的区域性特定信息`value`。The most common use of the `provider` parameter is to specify culture-specific information used in the conversion of `value`. 例如，如果`value`参数是一个负的十进制数字，`provider`参数可以提供有关所使用的负号和十进制分隔符表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if the `value` parameter is a negative decimal number, the `provider` parameter can supply culture-specific information about the notation used for the negative sign and decimal separator. 下一节中的第二个示例说明了格式提供程序不会提供区分区域性的格式设置信息。The second example in the next section illustrates a format provider that does not supply culture-sensitive formatting information. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`Temperature`类，并重写方法，但没有实现接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that overrides the method but does not implement the interface. 该示例演示如何调用方法中，依次调用`Temperature.ToString`方法。The example illustrates how calls to the method, in turn, call the `Temperature.ToString` method. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring5.cs#26)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring5.vb#26)] 下面的示例定义`Temperature`类，该类实现接口但不实现接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface but does not implement the interface. 其实现表示`Temperature`摄氏度、 华氏度，或开氏度，具体取决于格式字符串的值。Its implementation represents the `Temperature` value in Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin, depending on the format string. 该示例还定义了`TemperatureProvider`类，该类实现，并提供随机生成的格式化字符串，它由实现`Temperature`类。The example also defines a `TemperatureProvider` class that implements and provides a randomly generated format string that is used by the implementation of the `Temperature` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring_obj30.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring_obj30.vb#30)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示一个数字，`provider`可能会提供有关使用用于表示该数字的符号的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，如果可以使用参数`value`是用户定义的类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计用来存放两个 16 位有符号和 16 位无符号的值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 16-bit signed and 16-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#16)] 下面的示例演示调用方法将传递`HexString`对象作为参数，又调用实现`HexString`类。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#17)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果上`value`。The return value is the result of invoking on `value`. `provider` 是获取的实例对象。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供特定于区域性的格式信息`value`。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. 如果您不想处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是否成功。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义对象，它会将字符串"pos"识别为正号和字符串"neg"为负号。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 它会尝试将数字的字符串数组的每个元素转换为整数使用这两个此提供程序和用于固定区域性的提供程序。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an integer using both this provider and the provider for the invariant culture. returns.span: A 16-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

span.span: A 16-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅方法假设`value`使用未签名的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，使用所有 16 位来表示的数字值和符号位不存在。In other words, all 16 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，就可以编写一个有符号的整数值的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"to 32768 0x8000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to 32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#11)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员，验证方法或运算符在使用适当的数字表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释值转换为十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例确定值是否表示有符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当该示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是，并设置其高顺序位 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#12)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数值的字符串数组中每个元素，并将其转换为 16 位无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned 16-bit integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_2.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_2.vb#15)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示一个数字，`provider`可能会提供有关使用用于表示该数字的符号的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，如果可以使用参数`value`是用户定义的类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计用来存放 32 位有符号和 32 位无符号值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 32-bit signed and 32-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value.
