remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅方法假设`value`使用未签名的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，所有的 32 位用于表示的数字值和符号位不存在。In other words, all 32 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，就可以编写一个有符号的整数值的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"to 2147483648 0x80000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to 2147483648." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#13)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员，验证方法或运算符在使用适当的数字表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释值转换为十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例确定值是否表示有符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当该示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是，并设置其高顺序位 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#14)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数值的字符串数组中每个元素，并将其转换为无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/cs/touint32_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/vb/touint32_3.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定有关的内容特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示一个数字，`provider`可能会提供有关使用用于表示该数字的符号的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，如果可以使用参数`value`是用户定义的类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计用来存放 64 位有符号和 64 位无符号值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 64-bit signed and 64-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_4.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_4.vb#17)] 下面的示例演示调用方法将传递`HexString`对象作为参数，又调用实现`HexString`类。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16 时，您可以通过指定的数字`value`"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅方法假设`value`使用未签名的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，使用所有 64 位来表示数字的值，因而缺少符号位。In other words, all 64 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，就可以编写一个带符号长整数值的代码不在的范围内数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed long integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示该消息，"to 9223372036854775808 0x8000000000000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000000000000000 converts to 9223372036854775808." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#15)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换，始终是开发人员，验证方法或运算符在使用适当的数字表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释值转换为十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例确定值是否表示有符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当该示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是，并设置其高顺序位 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#16)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数值的字符串数组中每个元素，并将其转换为无符号长整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned long integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_3.vb#16)]
